ab.title: Genesis 23
ab.l: And the life of Sarah wasa hundred years and twenty-seven years, these were the years of the lifeof Sarah.
And Sarah died in the city of Arba,that is, Hebron, in the land of Canaan, and Abraham came to mournfor Sarah, and to weep for her.
AndAbraham rose up from in front of his dead, and he spoke to the sonsof Heth, saying,
‘Even if I am a stranger: but I wantto be a settler with you. Give me a possession of a sepulchrewith you, that I may bury my dead from in front of me’.
And the children of Heth answered Abraham,saying to him,
‘Hear us, my lord. You are a princeof God among us. Bury your dead in the choice of our sepulchres.None of us will begrudge you his sepulchre,|to hold you back| from burying your dead.’
AndAbraham rose, and bowed himself to the people of the land, to the childrenof Heth.
And he spoke with them, saying,‘If you are willing to bury my deadfrom in front of me, hear me and entreat for me Ephronthe son of Zohar:
That he may give me the caveof Machpelah, which is his, which is in the end of his field. For the full silverhe shall give it to me among you as possession of a sepulchre.’
And Ephron was sitting among the childrenof Heth, and Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the hearingthe children of Heth, of all who were coming to the gate of his city, saying,
‘No, my lord, hear me: I give you the field,and I give you the cave that is in it. In the sight ofof my people I give it to you. Bury your dead.’
And Abraham bowed down before the people of theland,

And spoke to Abraham Ephron in the hearing of the peopleof the land, saying, ‘Really, if only you would listento me! I shall give you the silver for the field. Take it from me, andI shall bury my dead there.’
And Ephron answeredAbraham, saying to him,
‘Oh my lord,listen to me. The land is worth four hundred mithqals of silver:what is that between me and you? And bury your dead.’

And Abraham listenedto the words of Ephron, and Abraham weighed outfor Ephron the silverthat he had spoken of in the hearing of the children on Heth, four hundred weightsof silver, current money with the merchants.

Andthe field of Ephron in Machpelah, which was to the east of Mamre, thefield with the cave that was in it and all the trees that were in the field,that were in all the borders all around was established:
For Abrahamas a purchase in the presence of the children of Heth, all who were comingto the gate of his city.
And after this,Abraham buried so Sarah, his wife, in the cave of the field ofMachpelah before Mamre, that is, Hebron, in the landof Canaan.
And the purchase of the plain,and of the cave that is in it was established, from the children of Heth for Abrahamfor a possession of a sepulchre.

app.note: K: The beginning of parashat Chayei Sarah is not indicated.
